item.title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
item.description:
Ingredients

  • 3/4 cup white sugar
  • 3/4 cup brown sugar
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 2 eggs
  • 1 cup softened butter
  • 1 tsp baking soda
  • 2 1/4 cups flour
  • 10 oz semi-sweet chocolate baking chips (2 cups)

Directions

  • Preheat oven to 375F
  • Beat together:
    • 3/4 cup white sugar
    • 3/4 cup brown sugar
    • 1 tsp vanilla
    • 2 eggs
    • 1 cup butter
  • To sugar and butter mixture, add 1 tsp baking soda.
  • Slowly stir in 2 1/4 cups flour. Depending on your butter, eggs, etc, you may need more or less flour. You want a mostly non-sticky batter.
  • Stir in 10 oz (2 cups) of semi-sweet chocolate baking chips.
  • Spoon out onto a prepared baking tray.
  • Bake at 375F for 10 - 12 minutes.

Source: Stella Trask

item.title: Peanut Butter Fudge
item.description:
Ingredients

  • 1 cup butter
  • 1 cup peanut butter
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 3 1/2 cup icing sugar
  • 1 tsp flour

Directions

  • Melt together 1 cup butter and 1 cup peanut butter.
  • Remove from heat, and add 1 tsp vanilla, 3 1/2 cup icing sugar, 1 tsp flour.
  • Pour into a pan, let set in fridge.

item.title: Butter and Butter Substitutes
item.description:
Butter

If you look at the recipes on this site, you will notice that a bunch of them use butter, or butter substitutes (technically margarine).

Unsalted vs Salted

I know most baking recommends using unsalted butter, and then add specific amount of salt to the recipe for flavor enhancement.

Historically, our family doesn’t add very much salt to their food, so we find that adding any amount of salt, especially baked goods, makes them much too salty.

Therefore, in our baking, we typically use salted butter, or a butter substitute that contains salt, and then don’t add any extra salt to the recipe.

Butter Substitutes

We have one child who is rather severely lactose intolerant, as in they can’t consume regular milk, yogurt or cheese. Even the brand of lactose free milk can make a difference, as it seems some are better at adding enough lactase enzyme over others. Pro-tip, Lactaid brand seems fine, as does the Aldi and Walmart brand lactose free milks. Kroger brand is not fine, at least in our family.

Therefore, we use plant based butter substitutes in almost all of our recipes, unless the recipe also includes cheese, in which case we don’t bother.

However, depending on what exactly is being cooked, in my experience it seems that different butter substitutes are more appropriate, factoring in taste, extra water added, etc.

I shop at our local WalMart, so this is all based on what I can buy there.

  • Great Value Unsalted Butter: goes in my coffee (yes, I like butter in my coffee), and also used in the cheese sauce for my Mac & Cheese.
  • Country Crock Plant Butter: In cookies, cakes and muffins, this is a straight substitute. However, this does not work for buttercream icing, roux, or bread dough based recipes like cinnamon buns. In the case of a roux, the butter taste is too strong. Buttercream icing ends up with a weird consistency. Bread dough doesn’t seem to rise properly.
  • Smart Balance Buttery Spread: This one I use when I’m making a dairy free or lactose free roux, like for our Chicken Pot Pie, and we also use in bread doughs and buttercream icing.

item.title: Chickpea Orzo Soup
item.description:
Ingredients

  • 1 Tbsp vegetable oil
  • 1 Tbsp minced onion rehydrated
  • 1 cup diced carrots
  • 3-4 tsp minced garlic
  • 1 cup dry orzo pasta
  • 1/2 yellow pepper, diced
  • 1 can garbanzo beans (chickpeas, 15.5 oz)- drain and rinse
  • 1 can fire roasted diced tomatoes (15.5 oz can)
  • 6 - 8 cups vegetable broth
  • 1 Tbsp Italian Seasoning
    • 2 tsp basil, 1 tsp oregano, 1/2 tsp thyme, some rosemary
  • Salt and Pepper per taste
  • 1 Tbsp lemon juice

Directions

  • Warm 1 Tbsp vegetable oil in large pot.
  • Add 1 Tbsp minced onion, and 1 cup diced carrots
  • Cook for 4 - 5 minutes until the carrots are starting to get a little tender.
  • Add 3 - 4 tsp minced garlic and 1 cup dry orzo pasta.
  • Stir frequently over medium heat to toast the orzo until garlic is fragrant.
  • Add 1/2 yellow pepper, 1 can drained and rinsed garbanzo beans, 1 can fire roasted tomatoes, 1 Tbsp italian seasoning
  • Stir together with everything else.
  • Add 6 - 8 cups vegetable broth and 1 Tbsp lemon juice.
  • Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes.
  • Serve in a bowl.

Nutritional Information

  • 1 cup (or small bowl) is ~ 210 Kcal.

Sourced and modified from Profusion Curry Chickpea Orzo Soup.

item.title: Chili
item.description:
Ingredients

  • 1 tbsp. cooking oil
  • 1 tbsp minced onion, rehydrated
  • 3 cloves minced garlic / 3 tsp minced garlic
  • 2 tbsp. tomato paste
  • 1 - 1 1/2 lb. ground beef
  • 1 1/2 tbsp. chili powder
  • 1 tsp. ground cumin
  • 1 tsp. dried oregano
  • 2 (15-oz) cans kidney beans, drained
  • 1 (28-oz) can crushed tomatoes

Toppings

  • Shredded cheddar
  • Sour cream
  • Thinly sliced green onions

Directions

  • In a large pot over medium heat, heat 1 tbsp oil.
  • Add 1 tbsp minced onion and cook until soft, about 5 minutes.
  • Stir in 3 tsp minced garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute more, then add 2 tbsp tomato paste, stirring to combine.
  • Add 1 - 1 1/2 lbs ground beef and cook until no longer pink. Drain fat and return to heat.
  • Add 1 1/2 tbsp chili powder, 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp oregano, and season generously with salt and pepper.
  • Pour in 2 cans (15 oz) of drained and rinsed kidney beans, and 1 can (28 oz) of crushed tomatoes and bring chili to a boil.
  • Reduce heat and simmer 20 minutes.
  • Season with more salt and pepper, if necessary

item.title: Roasted Sweet Potatoes
item.description:
Time

  • Prep: 10 minutes
  • Cook: 30 - 35 minutes

Ingredients

  • 4 cups chopped peeled sweet potato
  • 1 sweet onions (such as Vidalia®), cut into wedges
  • 2 cloves garlic, sliced
  • 3 tbsp olive oil
  • 1 tbsp balsamic vinegar, or more to taste
  • 1 pinch salt and ground black pepper to taste

Directions

  • Preheat oven to 425F
  • Mix 4 cups sweet potatoes, 1 sweet onion, and 2 cloves garlic in a bowl. Drizzle 3 tbps olive oil over the mixture and toss to coat; pour into a shallow roasting pan.
  • Roast sweet potato mixture in preheated oven, turning frequently, until the vegetables are soft and golden brown, 30 to 35 minutes.
  • Drizzle balsamic vinegar over the vegetables; season with salt and pepper.

Nutrition

  • 220 Kcal / serving

Original source: Allrecipes

item.title: Vegetable Barley Soup
item.description:
About

  • Prep time 30 - 40 minutes.
  • Serves: 4 - 8

Ingredients

  • 3/4 cup pearl barley
  • 1 tbsp cooking oil
  • 1 tbsp minced onion rehydrated
  • 2 tsp minced garlic
  • 2 carrots peeled and diced
  • 1/2 red pepper diced (or more)
  • 1 1/2 cup edamame beans.
  • 1 tsp thyme
  • salt and pepper
  • 8 cups vegetable stock

Directions

  • Put instant pot on saute and add 1 tbsp oil.
  • When hot, add 1 tbsp rehydrated minced onion, cook for a few minutes to brown.
  • Add 2 tsp minced garlic and cook for just a minute.
  • Turn off saute mode.
  • Add rest of ingredients.
    • 2 carrots
    • 1/2 sweet pepper
    • 1 1/2 cup edamame beans
    • 1 tsp thyme
    • salt and pepper
    • 8 cups vegetable stock
  • Set pressure cook for 20 - 25 minutes depending on how well done you like your barley. I found it was still chewy after 20 minutes and quick release, 20 minutes and 5 - 10 minute natural release might be fine too.

Nutrition

220 Kcal.

Notes

  • the original recipe called for 4 cups vegetable stock + 2 cups of water, I used 6 of vegetable broth, and while tasty, it could have been thinner, hence I’ve upped it to 8.
  • If you like a wider variety of vegetables, you could definitely replace a carrot with a stick of celery.
  • The original recipe said 4 servings, but we got closer to 6 and could definitely do 8 especially with any bread.

Originally from WachWhatYouEat.

item.title: Chocolate Chip Muffins
item.description:
Ingredients

  • 2 cups flour
  • 1/3 cup brown sugar
  • 1/3 cup white sugar
  • 2 tsp baking powder
  • 3/4 cup milk
  • 1/2 cup butter, melted and cooled
  • 2 eggs, lightly beaten
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 1 package semi-sweet chocolate chips (11 1/2 oz)

Directions

  • Preheat oven to 400F
  • Grease 12 muffin cups
  • In a large bowl, mix together:
    • 2 cups flour
    • 1/3 cup brown sugar
    • 1/3 cup white sugar
    • 2 tsp baking powder
  • In another bowl, stir together:
    • 2/3 cup milk
    • 1/2 cup melted & cooled butter
    • 2 eggs beaten
    • 1 tsp vanilla
  • Make a well in the center of the dry ingredients, add the wet ingredients and stir until just combined.
  • Stir in chocolate chips.
  • Spoon batter into prepared muffin cups.
  • Bake for 15-20 minutes at 400F until center seems done or tops bounce when lightly touched.

Nutritional Information

  • Total Calories: 3810 kCal
  • 12 Muffins: 318 kCal each

Sourced from Charishma Ramchanda.

item.title: Quiche
item.description:
Ingredients

  • 1 pie crust, warmed to room temperature
  • 6 large eggs
  • 3/4 cup of milk
  • dash of dried dill
  • pepper
  • 3/4 cup shredded cheddar cheese
  • 1/2 of a ham steak, cubed

Directions

  • Preheat oven to 375F.

  • Break 6 large eggs into a large bowl and scramble well.

  • Add 3/4 cup milk to eggs and mix thoroughly.

  • Add dashes of dried dill and ground black pepper.

  • Shred 3/4 cup of cheddar cheese and add to egg mixture.

  • Cube 1/2 of a ham steak and add to mixture.

  • Put pie crust into a 9” pie dish, pour egg mixture in.

  • Wrap edges of pie crust with aluminum foil to avoid burning.

  • Bake at 375F for 35 - 45 minutes.

  • Quiche is done when middle is set and stops jiggling.

Nutritional Information

2440 kCal for the whole quiche, and we get 10 slices out of it, so 250 kCal / serving.

item.title: Poutine Gravy
item.description:
• Prep time: 10 minutes
  • Cook time: 20 minutes
  • Total: 30 minutes

Ingredients

  • 1/2 tbsp oil
  • 1 small clove minced garlic
  • 2 cups chicken stock
  • 2 cups beef stock
  • 2 tbsp ketchup
  • 1 tbsp apple cider vinegar
  • 1/2 tsp Worcestershire sauce
  • 3 tbsp butter
  • 3 tbsp flour

Directions

  • Heat 1/2 tbsp oil in a saucepan over medium heat.
  • Add 1 small clove garlic and saute until browned.
  • Add:
    • 2 cups chicken stock
    • 2 cups beef stock.
    • 2 tbsp ketchup.
    • 1 tbsp apple cider vinegar.
    • 1/2 tsp Worcestershire sauce
  • Bring to a boil.
  • While that is heating, in a separate saucepan melt 3 tbsp butter and stir in 3 tbsp flour to make a roux.
  • Whisk stock mixture into the roux and simmer until reduced by half about 20 minutes.

Spoon over french fries and cheese, and enjoy!

Source: Chuck Hughes at Food Network.

item.title: Cherry Pound Cake
item.description:
Ingredients

  • 1 cup butter
  • 1 cup white sugar
  • 3 eggs
  • 1/2 tsp salt
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 1 tsp almond flavor
  • 1 tsp lemon flavor
  • 1 cup green glaced cherries
  • 1 cup red glaced cherries
  • 2 tsp lemon rind

Directions

  • Combine and beat together 1 cup butter, 1 cup white sugar, and 3 eggs. Add eggs slowly and beat together one at a time.
  • Continue beating until mixture becomes fluffy.
  • Add 1/2 tsp salt, 1 tsp vanilla, 1 tsp almond and 1 tsp lemon flavoring and mix.
  • Fold in the 1 cup each of red and green glaced cherries.

Bake at 300 degrees for 1 hour in a 10x5 loaf pan.

After baking, coat top with 2 tsp grated lemon rind.

Source: Cheryl Denton

item.title: Gum Drop Cake
item.description:
Ingredients

  • 1 1/2 cups sugar
  • 1/2 cup flour
  • 1.5 cups flour
  • 4 eggs
  • 1 1/2 tsp baking powder
  • 8 oz (1 package) cream cheese
  • 1 cup margarine or butter
  • 1/4 tsp salt
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 2 cups gum drops

Directions

  • Cut up gum drops and flour them with 1/2 cup of the flour. I cut them into 3 pieces and make sure each piece is floured. Refrigerate while preparing the cake batter.
  • Cream 1 cup butter / margarine & 8 oz cream cheese until fluffy.
  • Add 1 1/2 cups sugar, 1 tsp vanilla and 4 eggs 1 at a time beating well after adding each egg.
  • Combine remaining 1 1/2 cup flour, 1 1/2 tsp baking powder and 1/4 tsp salt.
  • Add dry ingredients to creamed mixture.
  • Lastly add the floured gumdrops and combine well.
  • Grease and flour a loaf pan or use parchment paper.

Bake 1 hour at 350 degrees.

Source: June Whitman

item.title: Cream Cheese Icing
item.description:
Ingredients

  • 8 oz cream cheese at room temp (1 pkg)
  • 1/4 cup butter (softened) (1/2 stick)
  • 1 tsp vanilla
  • 2 cups icing sugar

Directions

  • Blend together 8 oz cream cheese, 1/4 cup butter and 1 tsp vanilall.
  • Add 2 cups icing sugar 1 cup at a time, mixing thoroughly.

Goes well on carrot cake.

item.title: Carrot Cake
item.description:
Ingredients

  • 3 eggs

  • 1 1/2 cups white sugar

  • 1 1/4 cup oil (canola or vegetable)

  • 3 cups flour

  • 2 tsp baking soda

  • 2 tsp cinnamon

  • 1 tsp salt

  • 1 tsp nutmeg

  • 2 cups grated carrot

  • 1 cup crushed pineapple (not drained!)

Directions

  • Preheat oven to 350 F.

  • Cream together 3 eggs, 1 1/2 cups white sugar, 1 1/4 cup oil.

  • Mix together 3 cups flour, 2 tsp baking soda, 2 tsp cinnamon, 1 tsp salt, 1 tsp nutmeg.

  • Add dry mix to the previously creamed eggs, sugar and oil and mix well.

  • Add 2 cups grated carrot and 1 cup crushed pineapple and mix well.

  • Grease large tube pan very well!

  • Add cake mix, and bake at 350 F for 1 hour.

This makes a large cake. Cream cheese icing goes great, I recommend doubling that recipe to cover this cake.

Original source is Stella Trask.

item.title: Skinny Fettuccine Alfredo
item.description:
Ingredients

  • 1.5 tbsp butter / margarine
  • 1.5 tsp minced garlic
  • 3 tbsp flour
  • 1.5 cups chicken broth
  • 1.5 cups milk
  • 1/4 tsp salt
  • 12 oz Fettuccine noodles

Directions

  • In skillet over medium heat, add 1.5 tbsp butter / margarine and let it melt.
  • Add garlic and let it sizzle for just a minute.
  • Stir in 3 tbsp flour.
  • Stir in 1.5 cups chicken broth and use whisk to remove lumps.
  • Stir in 1.5 cups milk.
  • Let simmer for 6 - 8 min or until it starts to thicken.
  • For lactose free, leave out shredded parmesan cheese.
  • Mix into cooked Fettuccine noodles.
  • Add parmesan cheese to individual servings if desired.

Modified from Modern Honey Skinny Fettucine Alfredo.

item.title: Chicken Soup
item.description:
Ingredients

  • 2 tbsp butter
  • 2 cups diced carrots
  • 1 tbsp minced & dried onion (add water to rehydrate for frying)
  • 2 garlic cloves (or 2 tsp minced garlic)
  • 8 cups vegetable broth (two 32 oz boxes)
  • 1/2 tsp dried basil
  • 1/2 tsp dried oregano
  • dash of sage
  • salt and pepper to taste
  • 3 cups egg noodles
  • 2 cups cooked and shredded chicken breasts (see here)

Directions

  • In large pot over medium heat, melt 2 tbsp butter.
  • Cook 1 tbsp minced onion and 2 cups diced carrot in butter until tender (~ 5 min).
  • Add garlic and cook an additional minute.
  • Pour in vegetable broth and stir in 3 cups egg noodles; 1/2 tsp oregano, 1/2 tsp basil, dash of sage, salt and pepper.
  • Check the taste now and add any more seasoning you think it needs.
  • Stir in 2 cups shredded chicken (putting it in now means the chicken flavor will well permeate the soup, a plus if you are using vegetable broth, if using chicken broth, add it after simmering).
  • Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer 15 - 20 minutes.

From The Girl Who Ate Everything.

Notes:

Yes, I use vegetable broth. My digestive system does not seem to do well with the dried broth when you add enough powder to make it taste chickeny enough, and the same for “Better than Boullion”. If you really want chicken broth, go for it. In my experience, the vegetable broth tasted great, especially if you add the chicken before letting it simmer.

item.title: Poached Chicken Breast (Instant Pot)
item.description:
Ingredients

  • 5 tsp salt (or just a couple, really)
  • 2 bay leaves
  • 1 tsp dried thyme
  • 1 tsp rosemary
  • 1 tsp oregano
  • 4 cups water
  • 2 chicken breasts

Directions

  • Add dried herbs to instant pot insert.

  • Add 4 cups water.

  • Add 2 chicken breasts (either whole or in chunks).

  • Set timer for 0 (yes, really) minutes, or if not possible, 1 minute.

  • When pressure is reached, if you had to set 1 minute, get up and turn the instant pot off.

  • Hit “keep warm” to at least keep it warm but naturally release

  • For

    • 1 chicken breast - 12 min
    • 2 chicken breasts - 11 min
    • 4 chicken breasts - 9 min

  • Release pressure.

  • Check temperature with a meat thermometer. Supposedly 165F is safe, but I still prefer 180F.

Frozen

  • For frozen chicken breasts:
    • 2 chicken breasts - 3 minutes at pressure, 18 - 20 minute rest.

Wait, why?

As far as I can understand, we are using the heat necessary to get the mass of water + chicken to a boiling point to actually cook the chicken (poaching). This means that the more cold chicken breast you put in, the more heat it will take to get it to pressure, and therefore you need less time to naturally release. However, we are talking changes of 1 - 2 minutes, in salty water.

I use this to make shredded chicken breast for soup, chicken pot pie, etc.

Original guidelines are from Amy & Jacky Pressure Cook Recipes.

item.title: Pancakes! (No Milk)
item.description:
We have a kid that is lactose free, so we are always looking for ways to either make things without milk at all, or using a lactose free substitute.

Makes 15 - 20 pancakes, depending on how thin you make the batter. We like ours thicker, I got 16 pancakes, which meant for the 5 of us, we had 2 pancakes left over.

Ingredients

  • 3 cups all-purpose flour
  • 7 tsp baking powder
  • 1 tsp salt (or just a shake)
  • 4 Tbsp sugar
  • 2 eggs
  • 6 Tbsp margarine, melted
  • 3 tsp vanilla
  • 2 ½ cups water

Directions

  • In a large bowl, sift together the 3 cups of flour, 7 tsp of baking powder, salt, and 3 Tbsp of sugar.

  • Make a well in the middle, and pour in 2 eggs, 6 Tbsp melted margarine, and 2 tsp vanilla.

  • Pour in 1 cup of water and begin stirring together with a whisk.

  • Slowly add more water while whisking until you have all the lumps out of it, and add water to your desired consistency.

  • If you have addins like mashed bananas and chocolate chips, now is the time to add them. I’ve easily added 2 mashed bananas to this recipe without issue.

  • Lightly grease a frying pan (neutral oil spread with paper towel will work), and heat to medium high.

  • Pour a large spoonful of batter on, and wait for bubbles to form before flipping.

Adapted from Laura Fuentes.

item.title: ButterCream Icing
item.description:
Chocolate Icing

Ingredients

  • 1 cup icing sugar (also known as confectioners sugar)
  • 3 tbsp cocoa
  • 2 tbsp butter
  • 2 tsp vanilla
  • 1 - 3 tsp water

Lactose Free

For a lactose free option, you can replace the 2 tbsp butter with 2 tbsp of margarine, and you will only need 1 tsp of water.

Directions

  • Combine dry ingredients and butter into a bowl.
  • Mix using a hand-mixer on low speed.
  • Add water 1 tsp at a time, adding it and then mixing.
    • This is especially important when using margarine, as it has more water than the butter.

item.title: Never Fail Brownies
item.description:
Pre-heat oven to 350F

Uses a 9x9 baking dish. Doubled will fill a 9x13 baking dish.

Ingredients

  • 6 tbsp canola or vegetable oil
  • 1 cup white sugar
  • 2 eggs
  • 1/4 tsp salt
  • 1/2 tsp vanilla
  • 1 cup flour
  • 1/2 cup cocoa

Directions

  • Combine 6 tbsp oil, 1 cup white sugar, 2 eggs, 1/4 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp vanilla in a bowl.

  • Mix together.

  • Add 1 cup flour, and mix in.

  • Mix 1/2 cup cocoa with enough hot water to make a paste or slurry.

  • Pour cocoa mix into other ingredients.

  • Mix until cocoa is completely incorporated into the other ingredients.

  • Pour mixture into a greased baking dish.

  • Bake at 350F for 20 - 30 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out mostly clean.

    • If after 20 minutes it is still very gooey in the middle, check again in 5 minutes. Leaving it until 30 might result in dry brownies.

Source: Heather Raymond, family friend of Sarah Flight.
